stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Ash
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] Unknown
[Place of Birth] Unknown
[Date of Birth] Dec 24
[Race] Unknown
[Height] 170 cm
[Infection Status]
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Normal
[Mobility] Standard
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Excellent
[Combat Skill] Excellent
[Originium Arts Assimilation] ■■

Ash is one of the members of Team Rainbow. She is disciplined and committed, and as the team's acting leader, is in charge of formulating her entire team's battle plans.
Her main weapon is a customized M120 grenade launcher. It is capable of inflicting significant damage on heavily-armored targets. It can also be used to clear obstacles, increasing the number of options her squad has in combat.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Ash shows no signs of Originium infection.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] Undisclosed
Relevant data will not be disclosed due to the Medical Department's agreement.

Operator Eliza Cohen, codename Ash. A member of Rainbow Six and one of the firsthand witnesses to the 'Watchtower 33' incident, Ash registered with Rhodes Island as a cooperative party following the incident.
Ash is Team Rainbow's acting leader. Unmatched in her combat skills and commanding ability, she is particularly skilled in breach and entry. With her unique blasting techniques, she can demolish obstacles with remarkable precision to create covers or openings.
Undoubtedly, Ash and her team are extremely professional combatants. There is much that Rhodes Island operators can learn from their tactics and techniques, and I hope to get to know them better as we work together in the future.
Worth mentioning is that Team Rainbow members are only working with us temporarily. They are not formally employed by Rhodes Island, and with how much they have on their hands, it would not be advisable to call on their help too much.

Ash likes to keep to herself, and it is difficult to pry her away from her own affairs. At the same time, she is cautious and not prone to develop many close relationships. She is somewhat harsh in the way she manages her operators. Some would say she is too harsh, but there is always one thing and one thing only on her mind: how to bring her members home alive.

Miss Cohen is highly intuitive when it comes to architecture. When she first arrived at Rhodes Island, she pointed out several areas of the ship's construction that she said were structurally unsound. After examination, we were able to locate structural defects in those areas. Miss Cohen then assisted Rhodes Island operators in rectifying and repairing these defects. As Engineering operators supervised the repair process, they soon found that while they were still discussing the repair process, Miss Cohen was already putting theory into practice. While this likely was due to her existing knowledge in engineering and structural systems, perhaps more important is her experience in applying this knowledge to high-intensity situations. The solutions she comes up with are certainly not flawless, but her plans always carry minimum risk and are implementable with ease.
On top of that, she always prefers to take on the most dangerous tasks herself.

Even though Ash has been left exhausted by each and every battle she has been deployed in, she is nonetheless able to face her adversaries with composure. However, it is clear that she has become far more cautious with her planning after witnessing Metal Crabs bore through Blitz's shield with ease, and seeing Vouvire capable of throwing javelins over fifty meters. Any mistake she makes under her command can put the whole team in grave, irreversible peril. This is something she has come to understand very well after her recent deployments.
Therefore, in addition to making improvements to the way she commands, she has also started to rely more on her teammates' abilities: Frost's attention to detail, Tachanka's ability to keep calm, and Blitz's optimism. She cannot make all the decisions herself while they are stranded in this unfamiliar world, but they will all make the trip home together.
Team Rainbow will always be together.

[Classified Log]
Now that her firearm-like weapon has completely failed, Miss Cohen has opted to use a grenade launcher as her primary weapon. I think that's pretty good. The other guys had to take apart Mr. Alexsandr's weapon for analysis and then put something new together. It's a lot easier and much less aggravating to just spend less money on something off the shelf. Ahem, I digress. There weren't a lot of adjustments we had to make on Miss Cohen's weapon. All we had to do was modify it to use Originium rounds, or so I thought, but Miss Cohen was pretty particular about her ammunition.
She wanted rounds that not only stuck to the surface, but could then bore through it before blowing up? And without using Originium Arts? Just what were these things she's been using? She said she didn't know the exact procedures to recreate them, but she could share some of the know-how behind it. That sounds wonderful!
With Miss Cohen's help, we were able to create a prototype of the type of rounds she described. The process wasn't really a walk in the park, but it turned out pretty well! The only thing is... the whole process behind making these rounds is far too complicated, and so we couldn't use them as regular ammunition. In the end, we ended up taking a step back and made her weapon compatible with normal projectiles instead.

In conclusion, it's a lot more convenient to just use Originium Arts.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

<color name=#ffffff>Rainbow Six Collab Series/Ranger. This outfit, hand-picked by Ash herself, emphasizes both disguisability and sportiness. A specially-made hat conceals Ash's identity, facilitating intelligence-gathering and related work.</color>

skills.desc:
ATK <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</>, attacks hit <@ba.vup>{attack@times}</> times in a row
<@ba.rem>Unlimited duration</>

Immediately trigger the first talent. Attack Interval is <@ba.vup>reduced significantly</> and increase ATK to <@ba.vup>{ash_s_2[atk_scale].atk_scale:0%}</> when attacking <$ba.stun>Stunned</> targets
<@ba.rem>Skill activation grants 31 bullets and the skill ends when all bullets are used (Can manually deactivate skill)</>

Fires a Breaching Round forwards, dealing <@ba.vup>{atk_scale:0%}</> ATK as Physical damage to enemies in the line of fire and pushing them backwards <@ba.vup>significantly</>; The Breaching Round will explode and deal <@ba.vup>{not_hitwall_scale:0%}</> ATK as Physical damage to nearby enemies (If the Breaching Round hits a High Ground tile from a low tile, it will immediately explode and deal <@ba.vup>{hitwall_scale:0%}</> ATK as Physical damage); <@ba.rem>Can only be used 2 times every deployment</>

modules.desc:
Operator Ash has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude in both long-distance support fire and assault and breaching of fortified targets.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Sniper Operator during field operations. In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named, whether this band of soldiers needs such recognition notwithstanding.

Jacob Roland never thought much about it.
What it meant to be a Kazimierz competition knight of little renown.
To be able to find a job in Columbia.
Just how weird this job was.
Ironforge City, Southern District, in a small meeting room inside the Maylander Security and Defense Company’s office building.
He carefully wipes down his small shield and accompanying weapon.
Quietly awaiting the arrival of his 'superior.'
Jacob takes stock of the meeting room.
Five unique 'professionals' sit around him.
The Sargonian to his side is showing off his muscles.
This brawny man, over two meters tall, boasts that he could smash through the walls with brute strength alone.
The Bolívarian soldier talking to him is assembling a crossbow, the head of each bolt conspicuously marked with different colors.
The Leithanian caster leaning against the wall fiddles with an Arts Unit, the device occasionally emitting electric noises.
Closest to the window are two tight-lipped Victorian soldiers.
One of them holds a sledgehammer with a head larger than his own.

Each of them looks like they've been through a hundred battles, endured countless trials and tribulations.
But what about himself? The toughest battle he ever endured... was just a match in a Kazimierz arena.
Is he really qualified for this job?
Why would a Columbian recruit a group of warriors from all across the world?
Just as these thoughts run through his mind, someone pushes open the door.
A tall, red-haired lady wearing sunglasses walks in.
She has a small gun hanging from her waist, but she is not a Sankta.
She walks up to the podium, clearly in no hurry.

'Welcome to my squad.'
'You can call me Ash.'

'So, they've got a president?'
'Yeah, I heard that’s what they call their leader.'
'Wait, hold up a sec.'
'You just told me Victoria is ruled by a king. Leithanien is ruled by empresses, and Ursus has an emperor.'
'But the leader of the Columbians... is a president??'
'Yeah... Something wrong with that?'

The strange mercenary before Thumbtack seems lost in thought.
Ever since the mercenary team calling themselves 'Team Rainbow' showed up at Rhodes Island, the soldier woman named 'Ash' had been asking all kinds of strange questions.

'Then I have one more question.'
'Fire away.'
'Do they happen to have a city named New York?'
'Huh? Are you talking about County York? That's a city in Victoria.'
'In other words, Victoria has a County York, but Columbia doesn’t have a New York??'
'That's right.'

The soldier falls silent again, muttering something along the lines of 'this makes no sense.'
Thumbtack recalls an incident last week at the cafeteria, when Ash was shocked to see blue tomatoes and square potatoes.
Most of the operators were visibly perplexed.
Just what kind of country do they come from?

'Now that I think about it...'
Thumbtack decides to change the topic.
'When we get a day off this week, the folks from Engineering are going to play football on the deck. Want to watch?'
'Football... what exactly is that?'
'Have you never seen a football game before? 11 players on each side, and they try to kick a ball into the other team’s goal.'
'Oh! Yeah, I know that one.'
For a moment, the expression on Ash’s face becomes much softer.

That's something comforting to her?
Thumbtack remains at a loss.

voice_lines.voiceText: The most important thing my safta taught me was that life shouldn't have too many taboos.
Focus on the work at hand and don't jump to any conclusions.
Tachanka's taught me a thing or two about how to build defenses.
I have some questions, Doctor. I hope you can answer them for me.
Overcoming obstacles and breaking down barriers makes a lot of things easier.
I'm willing to try, as long as the reward is commensurate to the risk.
You think I'm strict, huh? I'll take that as a compliment.
Do me a favor. You worry about the strategy and let me worry about the tactics.
Rainbow Operator, codename Ash. I have my authorization and I'm ready for assignment.
The more we can learn about their attack patterns, the better off we'll be.
You can't really understand a conflict until you've been on both sides.
Let's get our heads in the game.
Let's show them what we can do.
That worked out better than I expected.
We knew the risks. We still have to see this through.
Happy New Year. Got any plans?

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, each Operator from <$cc.g.R6><@cc.kw>Team Rainbow</></> increases the Morale of all Operators in the Control Center by <@cc.vup>+0.05</> per hour
When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, for each <$cc.g.R6><@cc.kw>Team Rainbow</></> Operator, <$cc.bd_ash><@cc.rem>Intelligence Reserve</></><@cc.vup>+1</>
